title: 103_hr2609
content: The "Presidential Commission on TV Violence and Children Act" establishes a commission to address the harmful influence of television violence on society while maintaining freedom of expression. The commission's duties include researching the causal relationship between television violence and societal violence. The "Presidential Commission on TV Violence and Children" is established to review findings on the link between television violence and societal violence. The Commission will gather opinions from children, parents, experts, and industry professionals to lessen the negative effects of television violence. It will present comprehensive strategies to alleviate harmful effects while preserving free expression. The Commission, composed of the Surgeon General, the Attorney General, and 26 members appointed by the President, includes individuals from various groups such as broadcast television networks, parents organizations, and public health experts. Members serve for life, and vacancies are filled promptly. The Commission members serve for life and vacancies are filled promptly. Members serve without pay, and those who are federal employees cannot receive additional compensation for their service. Travel expenses are provided for each member. The Commission members serve for life without pay. Travel expenses are provided for each member. A majority constitutes a quorum for meetings. The Surgeon General is the chairperson and the Attorney General is the vice chairperson. Meetings are called by the chairperson. SEC. 6. The Commission appoints a Director and staff, who are subject to certain civil service laws. Federal agencies can detail personnel to assist the Commission. The Commission has the authority to hold hearings, take testimony, receive evidence, and obtain official data from government agencies. Members and agents can take actions authorized by the Commission. They can also use the United States mails and receive administrative support services as needed. Additionally, the Commission is required to submit reports. The Commission will submit a final report to the President and Congress within one year of appointment, containing findings, conclusions, and recommendations to address television violence. The Commission will terminate six months after submitting the report. $1,000,000 is authorized for this Act, subject to budget compliance.
